compounddef.title: I-J Square Root of Negative One

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Returns a complex value that represents the square root of -1. There are two functions that return the same value: y = i and y = j. This allows either i or j to be used as loop indices. The returned value is a 32-bit complex value.

sect1.title: Example
sect1.para: The following examples demonstrate a few calculations with i.
Here is an example of how i can be used as a loop index and then recovered as the square root of -1.

para.verbatim:
--> accum = 0; for i=1:100; accum = accum + i; end; accum
ans = 5050
--> i
ans = 100
--> clear i --> i
ans = 0.0000 + 1.0000i
